RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 1 300 Y Dirt CR: 68. Maiden Purse 6300. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ATHENA MAXIMUS speed, held on. SEE THE CLOWN fought gamely. PERRYS JAMBALAYA drifted in, late gain. EMBERLY solid effort. CHICKASWAY erratic trip. MONTE CRISTO YAYA good try. AZOOMN BYE broke in, lost path. BLONDIE PRIZE broke in, bumped. THEMSTHERULES bumped, ducked in midway. HOT FOR BLONDES needed experience.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 2 350 Y Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Purse 9500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF THREE RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KICKIN GOOD TIME popped, best. CHAVEZ LEGACY bumped, game second. OUR SECRET HABIT broke in, veered out, late run. HIGH ON CUERVO broke out, game effort. GREY BISCUIT close up, weakened. TRUE broke out, bumped both sides. HIGH SIX JESS bumped, altered path. STREAKINLADY PATRIOT bumped, squeezed start. XCELENTE broke out sharply.

ENTRY.NAME: Our Secret Habit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in, veered out, late run

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 5000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF A RACE IN 2023 OR NON WINNERS OF FOUR RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $2,500. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $3,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEBONNAIRE DUDE hustled to the front to share command from the two path to the three furlong marker then edged away and drew clear in the stretch. THE GREATEST EAGLE was off the pace in the two path on the backstretch then moved up around the turn and split horses at the top of the stretch to make a late run but was not enough. RANDOM AFFAIR stalked the pace down the backstretch from three wide then made a bid at the five sixteenths pole but faltered. MY PAL raced near the back in the early stages then steadily advanced down the backstretch, raced three wide around the turn and flattened out. FERRARI ROAD sprinted to the front to share command from the inside to the three furlong marker and gave way. CLIFTON PARK trailed the field in the early stages then made a rail bid around the turn to improve position. MORE ACTION raced in the middle of the pack and was not a factor. MORHAWK raced in the middle of the pack and was not a threat. FLY BUDDY FLY was off the pace in the early stages on the inside and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Clifton Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rail bid turn, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Debonnaire Dude
ENTRY.COMMENT: shared command, edged away, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: The Greatest Eagle
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, split horses, late run, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: My Pal
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, steady advance, 3wturn, flattened out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Claiming Purse 5800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF TWO RACES LIFETIME OR COLORADO BRED NO WINNERS OF THREE RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $3,500. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MUCHO GIFTED roused to the front to set the pace, drew clear around the turn and was kept to task in the stretch. PICK A LANE FRANK was off the pace down the backstretch then dropped to the inside going into the turn to save ground, moved out to three wide in upper stretch to take a late run at the leader but was not enough. BARLOWS PRIDE broke well, then prompted the pace to the top of the stretch and weakened. CHICKEN N BISCUIT raced near the back to the turn then moved up from two wide around the turn, tipped in to make a rail bid in the stretch but lacked the late response. DEACON BEACON tracked the leaders down the backstretch then moved up from four wide on the turn and flattened out. BURBACH saved ground but had to steading going into the turn, then didn't make a rebid. J P'S WEST ACRES lost his footing at the start and trailed throughout. A STEWARDS INQUIRY WAS POSTED INTO THE RUNNING INTO THE FAR TURN, AFTER A REVIEW NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Chicken N Biscuit
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, 2wturn, rail bid stretch, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Pick a Lane Frank
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, dropped to rail, 3wupper, late run, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Mucho Gifted
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, drew clear, kept to task

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 6800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF A RACE IN 2023 OR NON WINNERS OF FOUR RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $6,250.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BISCUIT SNATCHER rushed up to prompt the pace through the turn then angled out to three wide at the quarter pole and cruised by the leaders to prove best. OMACHE KID raced near the back early then moved up the rail through the turn but lacked room in early stretch and angled out to four wide at the eighth pole to prove second best. GREY ROGUE was off the pace down the backstretch then made a three wide bid around the turn to engage the leader at the five sixteenth pole and dueled down the stretch but was outfinished. HAWKWOOD raced in the middle of the pack and moved out to four wide in upper stretch but lacked the late response needed. CLEARLY MAD went to the front to set the pace for a half then was headed at the quarter pole and fought gamely in the drive but gave way grudgingly. NO LIMITATION saved ground while racing evenly. MORO APPEAL was through after a half. POLICY LIMIT never fired.

ENTRY.NAME: Grey Rogue
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3wturn, engaged 5/16, stretch duel, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Biscuit Snatcher
ENTRY.OWNER: Rust Terri Barton Ranch Stables LLC and Henderson Charles C
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, prompt pace, angled out, cruised by, best

ENTRY.NAME: Clearly Mad
ENTRY.OWNER: Rushton Stacey Eskew Stuart and Alfrey Vance
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, headed 1/4, fought gamely, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Omache Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, rail bid, lacked room, 4w1/8, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Hawkwood
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 4wupper, lacked late response,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 7200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF TWO RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EUSEBIO sprinted away to set all the pace and just lasted. BORN TO RACE saved ground through the turn then angled out to the two path at the eighth pole to make a late run but was too late. BRAVO KOLT raced off the pace to the quarter pole and weakened but stayed on to be the best of the others. IMPASSIONED CLAIM stalked the pace and chased the leaders home. SECRET SURVIVOR tracked the leaders but had no late kick. TIME TO SKIP TOWN raced wide down the backstretch then tucked in to save ground around the turn but was not a threat. RI' PIN SNAP hopped leaving the gate and was not involved. CHARLIE'S NO SAINT had a wide trip and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Born to Race
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, angled out 1/8, late run, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Time to Skip Town
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide backstretch, saved ground turn, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Eusebio
ENTRY.COMMENT: sprinted away, set pace, just lasted,

ENTRY.NAME: Bravo Kolt
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, weakened, best of others

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 12500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF 3 RACES LIFETIME OR COLORADO BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOYA PARANOYA stalked the pace down the backstretch then moved between horses at the seven sixteenths pole to duel for the lead around the turn and took command at the quarter pole and drew off. BRAYBRAY shared the command to the the turn then dueled for the lead from between horses around the turn, moved out to three wide in upper stretch and kept on the be second best. JONO shared the command to the turn then dueled for the lead from the inside of two rivals around the turn and weakened. THOUGHTS OF GOLD tracked the leaders from the inside but lacked room going into the stretch and finished evenly. RED WES bobble after the start and trailed down the backstretch, made a rail bid around the turn to improve position. AUDACE was not a threat. DIVINE TASK was off the pace to mid turn and dropped back. BEE EXXTRAVAGANT remained back. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS POSTED, THE JOCKEY OF BRAYBRAY CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF HOY PARANOYA FOR ALLEGED INTERFERENCE NEAR THE QUARTER POLE, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS DISALLOWED AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Thoughts of Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, lacked room, finished evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Red Wes
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled, trailed, rail bid turn, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Braybray
ENTRY.COMMENT: shared command, duel turn, 3wupper, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Hoya Paranoya
ENTRY.OWNER: Wood Linda L and Yergensen Judi S
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, between 7/16, duel turn, took command, drew off,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 9700. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LINEARSPEED pressed the pace from the inside then was challenged at the three furlong marker, fought off the rival through the turn and drew off in the strech. INCREDIBE MO was off the pace from between horses to the turn then move out to four wide in mid turn and made a late rally but was no match for the winner. PUT PUT PUT was off the pace on the inside then moved out to three wide at the five sixteenths pole, was tiring going into the stretch and drifted in but kept on to hold the show. TIZKANDOIT trailed in the early stages then rushed up to be in contention into the turn, moved between horses at the three sixteenths pole was forced in slightly nearing the eighth pole and fought gamely to the wire. MY CAIRO KID was off the pace from three wide down the backstretch then moved up to vie for the lead at the three furlong marker but weakened at the top of the stretch. IZZY IN A TIZZY raced near the back to the turn then saved ground around the turn and improved his position. DOMERGOO raced wide and passed tiring rivals. NAPO sprinted to a pressured lead to the three furlong marker and gave way. HELLO WALTZ was off the pace early from three wide to the five and a half marker then retreated. THE STEWARDS POSTED AN INQUIRY INTO THE RUNNING NEAR THE EIGHTH POLE, AFTER A REVIEW NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Put Put Put
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside, 3w5/16, drifted in, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Tizkandoit
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed early, rushed to contention, between 3/16, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Izzy in a Tizzy
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, saved ground turn, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Linearspeed
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, challenged 3/8, fought gamely, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Incredibe Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4wturn, late rally, no match

ENTRY.NAME: My Cairo Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, vied for lead, weakened,
